description.narrative: Energía Sostenible para Todos: Promoviendo hidroelectricidad a pequeña escala en Bioko y otras soluciones de energías limpias para islas remotas

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: A) Reducción de emisiones de CO2 directas y durante ciclo de vida y post-proyecto como resultado de demostraciones/pilotos apoyados por el proyecto B) Reducción de GEI indirectos debido a política del proyecto, desarrollo de capacidades institucionales y de movilización de recursos C) Capacidad instalada de ER (pequeña escala) y generación anual de energía D) Estatus de Estrategia y Plan de acción para ER HH) Número de ubicaciones evaluadas para la aplicación de sistemas PV solar o solar híbridos (viabilidad) II) Número de proyectos de hidroeléctrica pequeña operativos JJ) Número de eventos de sensibilización organizados y asistencia KK) Número de programas de formación en ER y asistencia LL) Número y estatus de campaña de información en ER E) Estatus del conjunto de reglamentos y procedimientos F) Número de fuentes alternativas de financiación identificadas G) Número de proyectos de ER propuestos para su aprobación (e implementación post-proyecto) J) Número de hidroeléctricas pequeñas evaluadas, de las cuales K) Número de proyectos de hidroeléctricas en fase avanzada de desarrollo L) Número de proyectos hidroeléctricas pequeñas que están operativos

It can be considered as an objective in the process of being achieved, but there are risks that will have to be managed such as the unavailability of funds on time by the government for the execution of the demonstrations and the current prioritization, by the government, on the implementation of renewable energies in the continental region.
Currently it has been achieved 322.944 TCO2 Calculation base: Emission factor used and based on the LCE system: 464g of CO2 / kWh generated Bicomo hydroelectric power station: Installed Power: 3.2 MW Energy Generated: 232 MWh / year (Estimated value. Must be done with the actual data) Emissions avoided: 232,000 kWh / year * 0.464 kGC02 / kWh = 107,648 TC02 / year x = 322.944 TCO2 Note: A more realistic emission factor should be considered for Equatorial Guinea, depending on the type of fuel most used for power generation. On the right track
Actions taken: • The revision of the draft Energy Law with the incorporation of the renewable energy theme in its articles, • The preparation of the Regulation for the Application of Renewable Energies; • The development of procedures for the approval and evaluation of proposals for RE projects; • Preparation of Support for anti-risk financial measures; • The elaboration and implementation of the Strategy and Action Plan for renewable energies; All these instruments mentioned serve to increase the reduction of carbon dioxide emissions indirectly; The project in its forecast of PTA 2020 activities marked as one of the priority activities, support for the technical validation of the Energy Law and its socialization, once sanctioned by the government to ensure the implementation of all other tools. indicated above and, therefore, the indirect reduction of carbon dioxide emissions. It was not done due to unavailability of fundas.
Without having enacted the Energy Law, the policy documents on the Implementation of renewable energies that have been prepared and delivered by the project to the Ministry of Industry and Energy, namely: the Procedure Manual for evaluating energy project proposals , “The Action Plan on Renewable Energies”. Anti-risk are allowing the development of renewable energy in the country. And, taking into account that the application of the aforementioned tools plus the Energy Law, according to estimates in the project document, a total of 7121 KTCO2 may be reduced. Currently, with the application of the three reference tools, it can be estimated that, to date, after the completion of the project, it could be reduced by It can be considered as an objective in the process of being achieved, but there are risks that will have to be managed
Currently it has been achieved
3.2 MW There are also government actions currently consisting of the implementation of nine solar plants in the new urban districts of new creation in the continental region of the country in its terminal phase. 5,340.75 KTCO2 Reached Action taken towards the achievement of the reference objective: The Energy Law incorporating the ER theme with its application regulations prepared. Lack of technical and political validation and sanction of the Law by the government. Reched Alternative sources of financing identified: Green Fund Program for Equatorial Guinea
Private sector, SARAIVA Private Company and associates. National Component based on funds from oil companies. Reached
Actions carried out around the realization of the objective: Completed, there are currently 7 projects, 2 more than planned (5) achieved based on austerity in the management of project funds. Among them we can mention: the Mbomo solar project, the Midjob Amvom solar project, the Kuma solar project, the Mebonde Elon solar project, the Annobón solar project, the Corisco solar project, the Ilachi hydroelectric project, the Belebú hydroelectric project. It went beyond expectations, given the very strong need for electricity found in the identified areas and the interest expressed by the government, through the Ministry of Industry and Energy, to supply electricity to these communities. There were three very close communities with problems of access to the governments electricity grid (Midjob Anvom, Kuma and Mebonde Elon), for this reason two additional studies had to be done in these small communities to carry out a network installation. Has been achieved
Ongoing actions to achieve this objective Evaluations were made corresponding to the potential of water resources, pre and viability, engineering details, environmental impact in Belebú and Ilachi, but to date it has not been possible to advance in its execution. The projects have been handed over to the Ministry of Industry and Energy and are waiting for the government, within its economic possibilities and priorities established in the framework of the implementation of its electrification and electricity supply program for the population, to finalize its details last decision and possible implementation. and Ilachio have already been evaluated In progress
Two risks must be managed, the unavailability of funds on time by the government and the reconciliation of the governments priorities in the sector and the projects objectives. Current status in terms of realization of the objective: 1, Bikomo Central in Bata Only the Bicomo plant has been rehabilitated, among the three foreseen in the project document (Bicomo in Bata, Riaba and Musola I and II in Malabo). In the 2019 Work Plan, due to the changes observed in the market, the government ordered that an evaluation be made of what the rehabilitation of the Bicomo plant could cost for its implementation with public investment funds. The evaluation began in 2019 and was carried out to the 2020 financial year since the service could not be paid in 2019. As the funds corresponding to the execution of the Work Plan, 2020 were not sent, the aforementioned evaluation has been paid for with the funds requested for the payment of the project staff salary in the framework of the financial year 2020. With regard to the rehabilitation of the Musola I and II plants, it was planned to make its evaluation of the cost of rehabilitation in the framework of the financial year 2020, which could not be carried out due to the unavailability of funds. Accomplished, Current status in terms of realization of the objective: the Mbomo solar project, the Midjob Amvom solar project, the Kuma solar project, the Mebonde Elon solar project, the Annobón solar project, the Corisco On the way to being achieved
But there are two risks to be managed: the governments lack of availability of funds on time and the reconciliation of the governments priorities in the sector and the projects objectives.
It should be noted that it is a solar project and not a hydroelectric project, it is a mistake. These invoices will be paid this year with provisional ASL for US $ 100,000 sent to the project for the payment of salaries.
